{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3410014,"name":"Efe √áetin","username":"Xegen","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/x/48db29/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-21T16:24:28.606Z","cooked":"

I just joined the Frc group and I want to help with the software in this group. We will use Java. Any advice you can give me? What should I learn first? What are the basic sections I need to learn?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-07-21T16:24:28.606Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":33,"reads":276,"readers_count":275,"score":220.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":468950,"topic_slug":"im-new-help-me-with-coding","display_username":"Efe √áetin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/accumulation-of-beginner-programming-resources/507044","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Accumulation of Beginner Programming Resources","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67284,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/im-new-help-me-with-coding/468950/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3410022,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-21T16:52:21.779Z","cooked":"

Here was my getting started list. You would swap #6 for your team code. I‚Äôd maybe add reviewing some of Controls lessons here. I‚Äôd also add these lesson plans as some good steps for FRC.

  1. Our robot code is Java. Learn basics (also CodeAcademy.com and Think Java)
  2. Learn git
  3. Read the docs: docs.wpilib.org
  4. Access the API for details: Overview (WPILib API 2024.3.2)
  5. Learn WPIlib Command-Based
  6. Clone repo at github.com/frc1108
  7. Utilize Example Code
  8. Learn 3rd party libraries: Phoenix (Falcon/CTRE), REVlib (Spark Max), Monologue, PathPlanner, etc.
  9. Utilize FRC community like tutorial videos and asking Discord or ChiefDelphi
  10. Practice using public code to expand what you know.
  11. Ask for help on public FRC Discord, PhotonVision Discord, ChiefDelphi.

There are plenty of tutorial series on YouTube, some better than others. I have a section for them sorted by how new they are in my FRC Java Resource Compendium, so feel free to take a look:

docs.google.com

FRC Java Programming Resource Compendium

FRC Java Programming Resource Compendium Official WPILIB System Documentation +++ https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/ +++ Development Environment Development Environment Installation Instructions:...

3847 Spectrum‚Äôs curriculums are also really good, and their Controls ‚Äòcourse‚Äô which includes programming does have videos to go along with them.

A great place to look at for high quality, well documented code is The Open Alliance. It‚Äôs a list of teams that make all of their work open source. This resource may be too in depth because you‚Äôre just starting out. However, it could serve as #10 of the list @ngreen made. Also, definitely use ngreen‚Äôs getting started list. It looks amazing!

For a fairly quick ramp up, ‚ÄúFRC 0 to Autonomous‚Äù holds up really well:

YouTube

Share your videos with friends, family, and the world

For leaning Java, this is my favorite resource. I really can‚Äôt speak highly enough of it:

learncs.online
